item.title: Pokemon Fan Designs Incredible $300 Shiny Magikarp Game Boy Advance SP
item.description:
Highlights

  • A custom golden Game Boy Advance SP based on Shiny Magikarp is for sale at $300. Unique design with gold plating and artwork.
  • The custom Game Boy Advance SP by SuperGusiLand can be upgraded to feature modern updates like USB-C charging, HDMI compatibility, and RGB LED buttons.

A Pokemon fan is currently selling a custom-made golden Game Boy Advance SP system that is based on a Shiny Magikarp. Not only that, this custom-made Game Boy Advance handheld console has a gold chrome shell, and is currently available for sale for $300. The custom gold plating, artwork, and upgrade from a normal Game Boy Advance SP might make it worth the purchase.

The original Game Boy Advance launched in 2001 as part of the sixth generation of gaming, and is the successor to Nintendo's Game Boy. The first iteration of Nintendo's handheld console was originally designed with a "landscape" form factor in mind, being more rectangular. A newer model with a backlit screen and clamshell-like design was then released in 2003, known as the Game Boy Advance SP, with a number of other improvements, such as a rechargeable battery. This model would become one of the most popular variants of the GBA sold. Fans have taken to customizing their own variants of the classic handheld, such as an incredible custom console designed after a Shiny Magikarp .

Related
Every Pokemon Game On The Game Boy Advance, Ranked

The Game Boy Advance handheld console had some of the most iconic Pokemon games. While they are all loved, some are better than others.

This custom version of the console is being sold through DK's Game Emporium , available for pre-order. The Game Boy Advance SP - Shining Magikarp Edition system starts at $300, and was designed by SuperGusiLand. This custom-made Game Boy Advance SP console has a gold chrome shell, with artwork of a Shiny Magikarp emblazoned on the top half. This art is based on the Shiny Magikarp Pokemon card from the Neo Revelation expansion of the Pokemon Trading Card game. The design of the card itself is based on the famous Japanese art, Hokusai's "The Great Wave off Kanagawa."

Nintendo Game Boy Advance SP - Shining Magikarp Edition by SuperGusiLand

This custom Game Boy Advance system also incorporates a bunch of modern features as well, alongside the classic ones. In addition to a newer backlit screen, fans can add USB-C charging, HDMI compatibility, and RGB LED buttons, bringing up the price to $530, excluding shipping. These additional features make for a handheld console that is a combination of contemporary and retro.

DK Emporium also allows fans to build their own custom Game Boy Advance SP systems, using a variety of custom color shells. Other Game Boy Advance SP systems designed by SuperGusiLand on the storefront include one that has a family of Pikachus, a Mewtwo and Mew one, and even one based on the infamously rare Pikachu Van Gogh Pokemon card . The gold shell and custom art alone might be worth it for a fan to spend money on.

item.title: Final Fantasy 14 Launches New Free Login Campaign
item.description:
Highlights

  • Inactive Final Fantasy 14 players can now enjoy a free login campaign until June 20 to catch up on missed content.
  • The upcoming Dawntrail expansion brings new playable races and jobs, as well as a level cap increase to 100 and new gear.
  • Returning players can also participate in ongoing events and sales, making it an exciting time to jump back into the game.

Final Fantasy 14 is bringing back its free login campaign for players who have registered accounts that have become inactive. The Final Fantasy 14 event is on now and will run through June.

Final Fantasy 14 regularly holds login campaigns to help encourage fans who have stopped subscribing to come back and see what they've missed. With the release of Final Fantasy 14 's next expansion Dawntrail launching its early access period in late June, this is a great opportunity to build excitement among gamers who have stopped playing for one reason or another.

Related
Final Fantasy 14 Reveals All Level 100 Job Gear

With just over a month until Final Fantasy 14 releases Dawntrail, fans get a close look at the level 100 Artifact gear for all 21 playable jobs.

Final Fantasy 14 's free login campaign is active as of this writing, and will run until June 20. Players who are interested will need to have a registered service account with Final Fantasy 14 that has been inactive for a minimum of 30 days. To play, all fans need to do is download the game and log in to the launcher using their established account. Once they log in, the free trial begins.

However, fans should be aware that this trial doesn't mean they can play from May 24 straight through June 20. Players are given four days to play, which includes the first day that they log in. On the fourth night at 11:59pm PDT, they'll no longer be able to access the game for free. In other words, players should plan on making the most of their time in the title. It would be wisest to begin the free access early in the morning, and over a period of four days where fans have ample time to spend in Eorzea .

It's a Good Time to Play Final Fantasy 14

In addition to the upcoming Dawntrail expansion, there's a lot currently going on in Final Fantasy 14 that returning players can enjoy. The repeat of the Yo-Kai Watch collab event is currently ongoing, and will run until the 7.0 patch launches. The game also just brought back its Fall Guys collaboration , which gives players an opportunity to earn free cosmetics, minions, and more.

Players who are missing some of the game's expansions may also want to check out the sale that's currently going on through June 11. Square Enix is selling FF14 's Complete Edition and Endwalker Editions for 60% off of the usual price.

Final Fantasy 14 's Dawntrail expansion will add the new playable race of female Hrothgar to the game, as well as the new jobs Pictomancer and Viper. The level cap is being raised to 100, new gear is being added for all jobs, and a visual overhaul will launch alongside the 7.0 update, promising to make the world and characters look better than ever.

item.title: GTA 3 Multiplayer Was Reportedly in Development Before Being Canceled
item.description:
Highlights

  • GTA 3 initially had online multiplayer but it was canceled since there was "too much to be done."
  • GTA Vice City and San Andreas also skipped online multiplayer.
  • GTA 3's legacy continues with mods and remastered versions contributing to the strong performance of the GTA Trilogy.

Grand Theft Auto 3 , the game that launched Rockstar Games into the stratosphere, originally included an online multiplayer mode which was eventually canceled. Alongside GTA 3 , GTA Vice City and GTA San Andreas are the only other main entries in the series to not feature online multiplayer.

The scintillating success of GTA Online , which launched days after GTA 5 in October 2013, is a testament to the franchise's potential as an online multiplayer affair. It turns out GTA 3 could also have had certain multiplayer elements had it not been for a late change of mind by the developer. Interestingly, GTA 3 skipping this avenue also set the path for the next few games that followed.

Related
5 Most Popular Myths In The Grand Theft Auto Series

Over the years, fans have uncovered and investigated many mysteries in the GTA universe, with some being so elusive they've become outright myths.

On Twitter, former Rockstar Games employee Obbe Vermeij, who worked on GTA 3 as one of the two Technical Directors, revealed that the action-adventure game initially had multiplayer. Answering a fan's query, the dev revealed that he "coded" GTA 3 's multiplayer before it was scrapped. Vermeij stated that, since the 2001 game's predecessor had this mode, it was also expected to feature something similar. He mentioned that even though the "basic gameplay was working," the multiplayer part was binned by developer Rockstar Games UK (formerly DMA Design/Rockstar North) as there was "too much to be done."

Moreover, Vermeij pointed out that similar efforts for Vice City didn't bear fruit either. By the time San Andreas rolled out, the console generation was coming to a close and there was seemingly little incentive to make key changes to the existing blueprint, leading to the developer settling for a co-op mode. Further, he highlighted that, with GTA 4 , things changed on this front as Rockstar Games hired "enough coders and level designers" to create an online multiplayer mode. All things considered, Vermeij's tweet answered yet another fan query, having resolved popular ones before, such as why the GTA 3 protagonist didn't have dialogue .

GTA 3 Continues to Be Popular Among Gamers

After more than two decades since its release, GTA 3 continues to generate significant interest from gamers. The appeal of this open-world game is such that the community is still building mods influenced by it. Case in point, a recent instance where a modder reimagined the world of GTA 3 with upgraded graphics by tinkering with the latest GTA game.

It's worth noting that GTA 3 's relevance today isn't just limited to the passion project of some individuals but also shows up in the form of sales. In tandem with Vice City and San Andreas , GTA 3 has contributed to the strong performance of the GTA Trilogy , which features remastered versions of the three games.

item.title: Gamer Makes Charming Stardew Valley Farmhouse Planter For Fan's Birthday
item.description:
Highlights

  • Celebrate a friend's love for Stardew Valley with a charming 3D-printed planter that combines tea, plants, and the player's farmhouse.
  • The obsession with Stardew Valley continues to grow as fans eagerly await updates and create art, recipes, and real-life proposals inspired by the game.

A gamer has created a charming Stardew Valley farmhouse planter for their friend's birthday, cleverly combining their love for the game with real-life gardening. The creation has gained attention from other players not only for its execution, but the way the player combined so many elements to make a Stardew Valley fan happy.

Stardew Valley is one of the most relaxing games around, and has firmly established itself as an indie game legend. Created by a single developer, the game has expanded greatly since its initial release due to the developer's dedication to his fans and the game. While there's plenty of iconic areas and images that players of the game will readily recognize, there's perhaps none so well-known as the player's home, where every day starts after they move to the farm on the edge of Pelican Town.

Related
Stardew Valley Fan Creates Adorable Birthday Cake Based on the Game

A talented Stardew Valley fan shares a look at the gorgeous cake they baked for their birthday, which highlights their love of the farming sim.

A gamer on Reddit going by the name of lisannevdl shared an image of the planter they 3D-printed for a friend as a birthday gift. The gamer explains that their friend loves three things: tea, plants, and Stardew Valley . This got lisannevdl thinking, and they chose to celebrate all three of their friend's favorites by printing out a version of the Stardew Valley farmhouse the player lives in that can be used as a planter. They placed a mint plant inside of it, celebrating the love of plants as well as giving them a way to make fresh mint tea.

The charming recreation of the player's farmhouse is spot-on, and has pleased fellow fans of the game. The gift has been called thoughtful and adorable, while one fan suggested that a Junimo Hut could also make a great planter. If the reaction from fellow fans of the game is any indication, the recipient will be very happy with this thoughtful gesture.

Stardew Valley Fans Celebrate the Game in Many Ways

Any video game can keep players occupied for hours, but the dedication of Stardew Valley fans is impressive. Many players attest to putting hundreds of hours in the title, either spending years on a single farm or replaying it again and again. This fascination with Stardew Valley extends beyond playing it, with fans regularly creating art and clever creations based off the game.

With the recent release of the Stardew Valley cookbook, many players have been excitedly creating their favorite recipes from the title, while others have even gone so far as to propose marriage in real life with recreations of Stardew Valley 's Mermaid's Pendant. With many players still waiting to try out Stardew Valley 1.6's update , chances are the obsession with this game won't be diminishing anytime soon.

item.title: Super Mario Run Launches Crossover Event With Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door
item.description:
Highlights

  • Limited-time Super Mario Run event celebrates Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door, offering bonuses and new content until June 27.
  • Event includes special missions to earn statues of Paper Mario, Goombella, and Koops from the iconic RPG.
  • Fans praise Intelligent Systems and Nintendo for remaking Thousand-Year Door, updating visuals and gameplay for Switch.

Nintendo has launched a new limited-time crossover event for Super Mario Run that is celebrating the recent launch of Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door . Super Mario Run is a mobile game that is a part of the mainline Super Mario series that first launched in 2016. This title is still getting updates to this day, with the game sometimes getting crossover events that are tied to newly released Nintendo Switch titles.

Back in March, Super Mario Run had a crossover event with Princess Peach: Showtime , celebrating the latter's release. The event ran for a limited time, giving players extra bonus medals and special items, concluding earlier this May. Players can now participate in an event centered around the Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door remake that launched on Nintendo Switch earlier this past week, getting new content and rewards based on the game.

Related
Rumor: Paper Mario: The Thousand Year Door Code May Hint at Nintendo Switch 2 Capabilities

Dataminers discover code in the remake of Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door that may hint at a possible new feature of the Switch 2.

Like past celebrations, this new Super Mario Run event will run for a limited time as well, with a bonus 1.2x multiplier being applied for the amount of medals earned in the level Remix 10. This gives players of Super Mario Run the chance to get special items from the Super Bonus Game, with this bonus being applicable until May 25th. The event itself is hosting special Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door -themed missions, with players being able to earn decoration rewards upon completing a certain amount. These missions will be available until June 27.

Super Mario Run x Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door Event Details

  • 1.2x Bonus Medals in Remix 10 (available until May 25)
  • In-Game statues based on Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door (available until June 27)
    • Paper Mario Statue: Complete three missions
    • Goombella Statue: Complete six missions
    • Koops Statue: Complete nine missions

These statues are based on some of Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door 's iconic characters ; Paper Mario himself, Goombella, and Koops. Both Goombella and Koops are part of Thousand-Year Door 's partner system, accompanying Mario on his journey. Goombella is a Goomba student who provides Mario and the player some additional flavor text and statistics about an enemy using her Tattle ability, and is the first partner to join. Koops is the second partner to join Mario's party and is an insecure Koopa teenager who embarks on a journey to get stronger for his girlfriend.

The Thousand-Year Door remake has been a huge hit on the Switch so far, becoming one of the highest-rated games of 2024, ranking among other games like Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth , Tekken 8 , and Balatro . Fans have lauded the remake for retaining the core experience of the GameCube original, updating and tweaking some aspects to not only make it better looking, but also addressing some criticisms of the original Thousand-Year Door . Fans are incredibly impressed with Intelligent Systems and Nintendo's efforts at remaking the classic Mario RPG.
